metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17669 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
WordPress before 5.2.4 has a Server Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability because URL validation does not consider the interpretation of a name as a series of hex characters.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17669` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 5.2.4+dfsg1-1
wordpress-l10n - 5.2.4+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentynineteen - 5.2.4+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwenty - 5.2.4+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentyone - 5.2.4+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.2.4+dfsg1-1').
